boardgame.name: Woodland Saga
boardgame.description:
Woodland Saga is a turn-based versus (online) strategy game.

In Woodland Saga you lead an army of woodland critters against an AI or against another player. Your goal is to either destroy your opponent's base camp or capture 3 different magical shrines.

During your turn you can either play an army card from your hand which places a group unit onto the board, or you can assign a new command to a group unit that is already on the board.

Knowing when and where to place units and when and where to move them to will be key in winning the game as different biomes, height difference, towns and other components will make a meaningful impact on your decisions.

Features

online play against other players
15+ different cards to find
hours of fun!

boardgame.name: Yardlings
boardgame.description:
Yardlings is a local multiplayer battle arena!

About

In this game your goal is to gain control over the entire yard and you are competing against others.
You play as a hero, like a tomato - a strong unit - you can easily take out 2 or 3 small mushrooms, but you won't stand a chance against bigger groups of enemies.
That's why the key to win is to gather your own forces and tactically place your troops at the right places at the right times.

Strategy

You have a few options.

- attack potted plants to claim them. pots will spawn units over time! this is the fastest way to gain a following

- attack flowers in flower gardens to claim those gardens. flowers heal and help evolve units in range. they also shoot seeds at enemies that are in range.

- flowers will also grow petals over time and become stronger with them. when a flower is fully grown it'll spawn very strong units! the flowers grow faster when there are more units guarding it, so consider stationing some units in a garden once in a while.

- you can either decide to run around picking up troops and stationing them, but from time to time you'll also want to help out in a fight. don't worry, you'll respawn at your base garden if you get defeated, unless your base got taken over..
when helping out, you might want to use your special ability. dealing damage will fill your special meter. once it's full use your special ability!

there are different types of specials and they can make a real difference if used right. to get these special abilities, pick them up at special ability plants!

How to win

there are 2 ways to win

1. control enough flower gardens to take full control

2. destroy and claim the base gardens of your opponent(s). if you do so, you'll be the only one left standing!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Csonti
boardgame.description:
Grab the most bones for your doggy!

Place all five bone cards on the center plate square. Deal 28 tiles to each player and place the decks on the yellow squares.
The first player draws a tile and places on the first square marked with an arrow. The red line must be continuous. Then it is the other player's turn, who draws a tile and places it on the first square. The game continues until one player reaches the center square and grabs one bone card. If the line goes out the game field, or runs into the other players line or ends in a dead end, the player must remove all his/her tiles and discard them. Then he/she must start from square one.

The player who gets the most bones of five, wins.

boardgame.name: lairchitect

Build your own lair and protect your precious soul core from heroes that try to raid your dungeon. Distracting heroes and using the right minions to defeat them is key in winning the game.

boardgame.name: COREWARDS
boardgame.description:
"Rejoice, for the signs are clear.
The presaged time has come.
All shackles of caste and clan are exiguous now.
Goyum beckons and the faithful gather.
Now, we must travel... COREWARDS."

A lore-heavy game set in an original semi-hard sci-fi universe, this game focuses on a card-based travel mechanic, with players competing to reach the entity known as "Goyum" first, who awaits them in the Milky Way's center.
Focusing on card memorization and deck manipulation, these travels are represented by three shared decks of cards, each containing chances to buy or sell various types of cargo, rare offers to obtain upgrades as well as more dangerous encounters.

COREWARDS requires you to manage three shared decks to further your own advantage, that is increasing your chances to reach Goyum first. This requires balancing your risks against potential gains, as well as tracking which cards are in play and in which deck at the moment. The game's unique selling point is the fact that the game's three card decks are manipulated collaboratively by all players each turn, instead of building one's own individual deck.

—description by the designer

boardgame.name: Vuureiland
boardgame.description:
When you arrive at Fire Island, everything seems like a paradise. But there is a volcano which is becoming very active, and only one player will be able to survive this nightmare...

The game board exists of a standard setup of hexagonal tiles, with the volcano in the middle of the board. On your turn, you play one of the six standard action cards that are the same for every player, like sprint/walk/push & steal/dig/look and rest (to get your action cards back). Every turn you play two action cards, and you try to dig up special treasures like God cards, which will give you special actions.

But, there is a caveat. There are ten rounds in the game, and every round the volcano spreads across the island, dictated by the random direction of the wind. The player who plays his cards right, who is able to receive the favour of the gods and who is able to stay away from the lava, will survive and will be the only one left standing... Let the nightmare begin!

—user summary

Wanneer je aankomt op Vuureiland, lijkt het met zijn slaperige vulkaan en witte stranden recht uit een droom geplukt. Maar schijn bedriegt. Terwijl de vulkaan langzaam ontwaakt, wordt er ook iets in jou wakker. Je vermoedt dat dit verhaal mogelijk langzaam een nachtmerrie wordt; een nachtmerrie die eindigt in goud en bloed.

Verover machtige schatten, paai wraakzuchtige goden en schakel sluwe tegenstanders uit voor de vulkaan uitbarst. Ben jij klaar voor de ultieme vuurproef?

—description from the back of the box

Scrutiny: It's All About Me! sees players taking turns to be put in a scenario where there are three possible outcomes. The player in the spotlight has to choose which of the three outcomes best relates to them. All other players have to guess the outcome they chose. Every turn sees a new challenge, and with six thousand possible scenario outcomes, it's a different game every time you play it!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Blood Bowl 2 - DEATH ZONE

boardgame.name: Jungle Tribe
boardgame.description:
The jungle’s tribe chief has passed away. The time has come, for you as a young tribe member to prove, yourself and show that you should become the future leader. You still have much to learn so you decide to complete 3 dangerous Quests through the jungle: a journey to search for the 3 great masters in order to learn from the Wisest Elder, the Strongest Tribesman, and the Jungle Saint.

The game is played in two phases. In phase 1, players try to pick their 3 quests strategically, and in phase 2, players try to collect as many points as possible while completing their 3 quests through the jungle. Once a player completes all three quests, the game ends. The player with the most points wins the game. Points can be obtained in four ways: (1) Level of the player's Quests, (2) Successfully played Experience Cards through dice-rolling mechanisms, (3) Special Cards in the player's hand at the end of the game - hand management mechanism requires players to keep the best combos in their hand, and (4) completion bonus when having completed all 3 Quests.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Panoptic
boardgame.description:
THE OVERSEER IS WATCHING.

Panoptic is a local multiplayer VR game that pits you against a friend, where you play as either the giant Overseer or tiny Challenger in a stealthy game of cat and mouse. Will the Challenger slip away undetected through the crowds, or will the Overseer track them down with their powerful laser eye?

Panoptic is an asynchronous multiplayer VR game, with one person controlling a giant character (the Overseer) with room-scale VR and one controlling a normal-sized character (the Challenger) with keyboard and mouse or gamepad.

For the Challenger, the goal of the game is to stealthily reach the top of the temple and destroy the artefact powering the Overseer. In order for them not to be seen by the Overseer, they will need to make use of their surroundings, as well as hide in plain sight within the crowds.

In turn, the Overseer's goal is to stop the Challenger from ever reaching the artefact, by burning them with it's scorching gaze.

Source: The Game Website.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Houlala
boardgame.description:
Small pocket game which could be a drinking game as its challenges lend themselves well to it. The game consists of series of cards with one task (counting from 0 to 20 or from 20 to 0) with one condition, e.g. for all the numbers of 5 letters say "bing" or if your number contains a T raises your fist, etc.
Players around the table each count in turn. If no one is wrong, add a new condition (to a maximum of four).
Players can choose to play together or to eliminate players who made a mistake.

—user summary

boardgame.name: På spåret QUBE
boardgame.description:
Trivia game based on the popular swedish quiz show "På spåret". Two teams takes three turns each, guessing a city destinations and answering questions about them.

On a turn the active team first tries guess the destination by listening to progressively easier clues. For each clue needed, the points value for the correct answer drops, but a wrong answer scores 0 points. Then the active team is asked four questions related to the destination, worth a point for each correct answer.
The team with the most points at the wins.

boardgame.name: Jumanji
boardgame.description:
Not to be confused with Jumanji.

Prop replica of the iconic Jumanji game featuring detailed sculpts and full graphic artwork both at the inside and outside. Rules and components have been included to make the prop replica actually playable. Note that the rules differ completely from those of the previously released board game.

The rules are relatively simple. You start with a Jumanji die which defines your action during a turn. The options are: rolling the dice for movement (in some cases against other players), collecting an additional life card (you start with three in your hand) or drafting a Jumanji card. The Jumanji cards can be both positive and negative and may lock a player on a certain space until being freed. All in all it concerns a game of chance based on dice rolling and card drafting.

Although the goal is to be the first player to reach the city of gold (Jumanji), this game is partly cooperative in that Jumanji wins when all players are locked on their space or have lost all of their lives.

boardgame.name: Emil i Lönneberga: Äggjakten
boardgame.description: A roll-and-move game where players and Emil tries to collect the most eggs by gathering hens from around the garden. The players can also try to take hens from the hen house, guarded by Emil's pig. At the end of the game the hens are turned over and the player with the most eggs win.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Turducken
boardgame.description:
A dastardly game of deception all in the name of a great dinner! Watch out for your fellow hunters and drive them into the rails as fast as you can so you can be the one feeding the family!

Turducken is a fast paced game that focuses on player interaction with a "take that" game style. The game is for 2-6 players that are 10+ years old and usually takes anywhere from 30 minutes to an hour to play. Winning the game is the name of the game, hunt and kill yourself a Turducken. One chicken, one duck, and one turkey is all you will need to win. Your chosen hunter has special abilities and you can gather and play action cards to help yourself or damage your opponents ability to hunt. A great family game with high replayability from multiple hunters to control and very dynamic game play from player interaction.

The rules are pretty simple, you can shoot at a bird (but make sure to name it first!), reload, draw /play action cards. You have a likelihood to hit that is different for each hunter that you have to roll above and each hunter has a special ability. Each hunter has a number of hits each bird must take from their weapon before they are dead. The action cards can be bonuses, minuses, or ways to mess with your opponents.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: När då då: Resor i världen
boardgame.description:
A standalone expansion for När då då (The Best of Chronology) with cards containing trivia related to travel and journeys in history.

Gameplay is similar to the original game. On the players turn, an opponent draws a card from the deck and reads the text on the card. If the player successfully points out where the card should go in their current timeline, the card is added above the player Time lock and the player may then either decide to end the turn and move the cards above the time lock to the safety below it or try to get another card. If the player fails to place a card correctly, all cards gained in the current turn are lost, the turn ends and play passes to the next player.

The winner is the first player to win five cards.

When used with the original game, the cards from this game is added as another category. A new six-sided die and cardboard markers 1-6 are included to choose the category.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Mako Naval
boardgame.description:
Mako Naval is a game around the naval battle theme. Each player must cross the ocean with his ship and reach the other side before the others ships, while sinking and delaying the others ships thanks to mines.

On his turn, the player moves his boat forward one space in the direction of his choice and then rolls the die. The die indicates how far he can land a mine in any direction he chooses.

If the mine hits another boat, it returns to the starting point. If not, the mine stays and block the boat from others colors.
A boat can pass over a square with a mine of its own color and recover it.

The first boat to arrive on the other side of the board, facing its starting point, wins.

boardgame.name: Les fous du volant
boardgame.description:
This game is taking place in the universe of the "Wacky Races" cartoon. The goal is to drive first one of your car in the right colored space at the opposite of the board. It's a game without any chance, only strategy.

When a car has to move, the player choose one of the three spaces in front of him. It can't go back or on a side space. All cars, from the beginning to the end of the games should be on spaces that touch either at an angle or on a side another car.

boardgame.name: The Room VR: A Dark Matter
boardgame.description: The British Institute of Archaeology, London, 1908: The disappearance of an esteemed Egyptologist prompts a Police investigation into the unknown. Explore cryptic locations, examine fantastic gadgets and uncover an otherworldly discovery which blurs the line between reality and illusion.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Game Direction of the Year Nominee
2020 Steam Awards Best VR Game of the Year Nominee
2021 D.I.C.E. Best Immersive Reality Game of the Year Nominee
2021 Game Developers Choice Awards Best VR/AR Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Blanc-manger Coco Galette Complète
boardgame.description:
Galette complète is the ninth expansion for Blanc-Manger Coco. It contains 40 question cards and 160 answer cards themed about Brittany.

One player is designated "question master" and reads a blue card with a hole-in-the-wall sentence (s), all other players pose a white card. Whoever posed the funniest card wins the round then reads the next blue card and so on. The first player with 5 points is the lucky winner!
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Blanc-manger Coco: Au fond du trou
Blanc-manger Coco: Au fond du trou

boardgame.name: Streets of Red: Devil's Dare Deluxe
boardgame.description: Welcome to Streets of Red: Devil's Dare Deluxe, the permadeath multiplayer horror beat'em up that bestows players with the skills of retro gaming heroes in a fight against a legion of undead monstrosities. The chills, thrills, bills, and opportunity to learn new skills won't stop until every street runs red with blood!

boardgame.name: The Unbelievable Truth Game
boardgame.description:
Based on the hit BBC Radio 4 panel game, the Unbelievable Truth Game is a game in which the truth is stranger than fiction. If you can tell fibs without batting an eyelid or you can embroider the truth like a pro, then this is the game for you.

Players take turns trying to smuggle unbelievable truths past their opponents in a series of quick fire and lecture rounds. If you can spot when a "truth" is fact or fiction, ring the bell to win a point.

boardgame.name: レディファースト (Lady First)
boardgame.description:
レディファースト (Lady First) is a shedding game from Japan, with each card controlling which successive cards may be played.

The game has a romantic theme, with one set of red cards themed for a woman, and a blue set for a man. Each cards carries various romantic lines (all in Japanese), that the players ought to speak as they play, such as

"Don't let me go"
"I'm glad to see you"

However, the game is designed for any adult players, not simply opposites.

The red deck has 12 cards numbered from 1 to 12 (and this player starts), the blue deck has 11 cards from 2 to 12. If the blue player can get the red player to play all 12 of their cards first, blue wins. Otherwise, blue loses.

On their turn, a player may draw one card from their deck, up to a hand limit of five, or play a card to the table.

Along the bottom of each card is a set of numbers, one for blue and one for red. These say what card can be played after this card. For example, the blue 5 can be followed by a blue 2,3,4 and 6 or by a red 4 or red 6-12.

As players go through their deck, they must carefully decide which cards to hold and which to play, in order to push more cards out of their opponent's hand.
user summary
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: レディファースト (Lady First)
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: 米光と抜群のゲームデザイナーズ (Yonemitsu to batsugun no gēmudezaināzu)

boardgame.name: レディファースト (Lady First)
boardgame.description:
レディファースト (Lady First) is a re-implementing of レディファースト (Lady First), with additional sets of cards to allow 3 or 4 players as well as the original 2 player game. Two sets of male cards have been added, otherwise the gameplay is the same.

The game has a romantic theme, with one set of red cards themed for a woman, and blue sets for a man. Each cards carries various romantic lines (all in Japanese), that the players ought to speak as they play.

Players draw and play out hand cards, with a set of numbers on each card controlling which others may follow it. If the blue player can get the red player to exhaust their cards first, blue wins. Otherwise, blue loses.

The red deck has 12 cards numbered from 1 to 12 (and this player starts), the blue deck has 11 cards from 2 to 12. On their turn, a player may draw one card from their deck, up to a hand limit of five, or play a card to the table.

Along the bottom of each card is a set of numbers, one for blue and one for red. These say what card can be played after this card. For example, the blue 5 can be followed by a blue 2,3,4 and 6 or by a red 4 or red 6-12.

As players go through their deck, they must carefully decide which cards to hold and which to play, in order to push more cards out of their opponent's hand.
user summary
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: レディファースト (Lady First)

boardgame.name: Iron Conflict
boardgame.description: Fight for glory in Iron Conflict, an online competitive real-time strategy game that features both modern and WW2 aircrafts and tanks. Make use of military tactics and choose from hundreds of different units to win on the ground and in the air!

boardgame.name: Ryte - The Eye of Atlantis
Ryte: The Eye of Atlantis
boardgame.description: A VR experience that takes you through an epic journey as you travel back to the ages of mythical

boardgame.name: Cyber Shadow
boardgame.description: Featuring an 8-bit aesthetic, it follows a cybernetic ninja named Shadow who sets out to rescue his clan in a world overrun by machines.

boardgame.name: Dinosaur on the Moon
boardgame.description:
From product listing:
The heroes are attending a recruitment workshop at the prestigious Tsygan Intergalactic Boarding School (TIBS). As a reward, they are being given an exclusive tour of the school's Dinosaur Zoo before it's open to the public. When they arrive, they quickly realize something has gone horribly wrong. Someone (or something) has hacked the zoo's security systems and dinosaurs are roaming free. Can the heroes find out what happened and put a stop to the chaos?

Included in this Premium Adventure:

14 encounter adventure book with 40 points of interest/mini-encounters
9 new maps that connect to form one gigantic map of the moon zoo
6 new Hero Cards (Honor Student, Delinquent, Gearhead, Gymnast, Wrassler, Geek Grrl)
8 new Monster Cards (Deinonychus, Velociraptor, Pteranodon, Kentrosaurus, Triceratops, T-Rex, Security Bot 1500, Security Bot 2000)
4 new Pet Cards (Deinonychus Pup, Deinonychus Adult, Touragotchi, Touragotchi 2.0)
8 Item Cards (Level 1-3 Access Cards, Ion Battleaxe, Battery Pack Blaster, Focus Booster, Plate Carrier, Luxcess Spaceship Keys)
Dino Plaques, Puzzles and more!
All hero/monster/pet cards/minis include both b&w and full color versions. Also includes printer-friendly version.

Requires Hero Kids from Hero Forge Games. Distributed through the Hero Kids Creator’s Guild at DriveThruRPG.

boardgame.name: Starguild: Space Opera Noir
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

In space, nobody can hear you scheme… Space Opera style science fiction, with a noir twist!

Starguild: Space Opera Noir is a traditional tabletop RPG. In 238 pages futuristic weapons and faster than light travel meet heartbreak, decadence and betrayal. Be brave naval officers or devious smugglers. Match wits and passion in high society or creep through ganglands in derelict cities. Explore dangerous jungles on the frontier worlds or engage as high tech mercenaries on future battlefields. But every decision comes with a price.

All this is underlaid with the essential noir setting details - cynical, ambitious, cruel; with dark undertones of emotional blackmail, sex and betrayal. Conflicting agendas and fragile trust. Secret deals and complex intrigues. The good guys do not always win. The good guys do not always live. The good guys are not always good guys.

To support this atmosphere, the game treats social conflict - the ability to alter someone's emotions and thinking - as equally important as fist and gun in enforcing your will. There are many ways that adventurers can achieve their objectives, including manipulating their friends and allies should the need arise. But beware - lest your head be turned by seduction, poisoned by distrust, swindled out of something important or taunted into an irrational act!

boardgame.name: A Cool and Lonely Courage
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It is the Second World War. France has fallen to the Nazis and Churchill needs to disrupt Hitler's war machine. The Special Operations Executive (SOE) recruits women as well as men for combat operations. It was extraordinarily dangerous. One third of those women who worked in occupied France were captured and killed.

This is an immersive table top story game for 2-5 players. A game session can take from 2-4 hours to play. All you need is a pack of playing cards, some paper and pens and this short rulebook. You don’t need any historical knowledge to play - I have filled the rulebook with real-life examples that will help steer you towards the kind of situations and dilemmas which were faced by women working in the SOE.

This game gives you an opportunity to tell your own stories of courage and sacrifice, and to honour the women who did it for real.

boardgame.name: Treasure Cats
boardgame.description:
In Treasure Cats you play as an anthropomorphic cat trying to find treasure. Each round you will choose to go to the one of two Locations. The Junkyard or the Farmstead,to find Items. Each Item has a Value. At the end of each round, players reveal their Treasure Cards and see which Location yielded the highest Items value. All players who chose that Location get a Victory Point.

Objective:The first player to score 5 Victory Points wins if no other player has 5 or more Victory Points. 6 Victory Points wins if no other player has 6 or more Victory Points.7 Victory Points everyone with 7 shares the win.

Setup:Pick a starting player. At the beginning of each round, the starting player shuffles the cards and deals 2 cards face-down to each player. Then they deal 2 of the remaining cards face up in the center of the play area. Each round has 3 phases.

Phase 1: Choose Treasure Cards.
Opening with the Start Player and moving clockwise, each player will choose a card in their hand as a Treasure Card. They will place this card face up in front of them. Using the other card, hide either the top or bottom half of the shown Treasure Card so that only the Item or Location is visible. *This is very important!

Phase 2: Trigger Active Abilities
Beginning with the Start Player and continuing clockwise, each player displaying an Item with an Active (A) ability may use it.
For example, if a player is showing the Compass, they would choose another player with a revealed Item. The targeted player would have to discard their revealed Item card if they correctly guessed the targeted players location.
Note: A player can only be targeted by the Compass, Abacus, Whistle and Dog Mask once per round.

Phase 3: Award Victory Points
All players now reveal their chosen Treasure Cards unless their Treasure Card was discarded in Phase 2. Each player with a Treasure Card showing a Passive (P) ability may now use that ability.
Add up the value for each Item at each Location. The Location with the highest value of Items wins the round.
Each player with a revealed Treasure Card with the winning Location receives 1 Victory Point. If there is no winning Location, then all players with a revealed Treasure Card earn 1 Victory Point. If a player had to discard their Treasure Card, then they cannot receive Victory Points.
After Phase 3 is complete, check to see if any player has achieved the winning objective. If not, then pass the Start Player token clockwise and start a new round.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Wantotrip: Le Tour Du Monde
boardgame.description:
The game was created by a Tunisian travel start-up to fight the pandemic.

The players start with the same amount of money and travel the world, rolling dice.
When they arrive in a new country they have to pay for their stay (based on the average cost for each country), then they can continue travel, or decide to work there.
They just don't have enough cash to go around without stopping by and working in some of these locations (answering trivia questions).
They can also play special cards (Cruella) to delay their opponents.

The winner is the the first player to complete the World tour.
The goal of the game is also to teach tricks to players for their future travels.

There is an expansion for kids (optional but not sold separately !)

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000: Armageddon – Da Orks
boardgame.description: In Warhammer 40,000: Armageddon - Da Orks, a new turn-based strategy game, players will lead the Orks against the Imperial forces of the Armageddon Steel Legion and Space Marines from a variety of Chapters, under a scorching sun, through hostile ash wastes, and in the shadows of gigantic Hive Cities.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Underworlds: Online
boardgame.description: Lead your fighters to Glory in the ultimate PvP dice-and-cards strategy combat game. Warhammer Underworlds: Online pits mighty warbands against one another in an eternal battle for glory in the realms of the Age of Sigmar.
boardgame.videogameexpansion: Warhammer Underworlds: Online - Warband: Eyes of the Nine
Warhammer Underworlds: Online - Warband: The Chosen Axes
Warhammer Underworlds: Online - Warband: Thorns of the Briar Queen

boardgame.name: Warhammer: Chaos & Conquest
boardgame.description: MMORPG and strategy gameplay in one. Living realms of Chaos Champions battle in PVE and PVP strategic combat. Persistent army management and constant live events. Collect Warlords, manage resources, and conquer your foes.

boardgame.name: Chicago 1930
boardgame.description: The Mafia rules the city. A special police task force is formed to take down his gang. This squad is managed by two cops. An open war breaks out throughout the city of Chicago. Now it’s your turn to choose your side!

boardgame.name: solipsism
boardgame.description:
This is a tool for solo roleplaying.

Solipsism is a collection of blank lists. You fill the lists with people, places, and things from your RPG. Everything you write down is secretly entangled into a puzzle. Locations are connected in different ways. Characters and objects are hidden. At each location you are given a choice of paths to follow. When you follow a path, a piece of the puzzle is revealed, then you receive another set of choices. Clues, dead ends, and a few surprises are included along the way.

In other words, you pick anything you want from your RPG, and Solipsism secretly weaves it into a unique game for you.

boardgame.name: Grimdark Future: Jakob's Path – Narrative Campaign
boardgame.description:
Jakob’s Path is a narrative campaign for Grimdark Future that follows the story of Jakob, a ruthless Battle Brothers captain, in his quest to conquer the Orc world of Zeloria-M5, whilst searching for a mysterious artifact.

This game expansion for Grimdark Future takes players on an adventure across 10 missions which are tied together by an exciting story of epic proportions. Rules for unit progression are also included, so you can watch your armies grow and evolve throughout the campaign.

Even though this narrative campaign was written with Battle Brothers and Orc Marauders in mind, it is easy to imagine this type of clash to be happening between any of the other factions in the galaxy, so feel free to swap them out with whatever armies you have available to play.

Note that to play this campaign you’re going to need the core rules for Grimdark Future as well as some army lists

boardgame.name: Moral Conflict
boardgame.description:
From the questionable to the downright detestable, it's time to find out what your friends really think of you with this game of moral dilemmas!
From "which of us is most likely to complain in a restaurant?" to "which of us is most likely to go to jail for tax evasion?", take turns to read out the cards and nominate a player. It's the perfect party game for bad people!

—description from the back of the box

boardgame.name: Morkredd
Mørkredd
boardgame.description:
You are the Orb's protector, and the Orb's light is yours. Survive and master over 60 puzzles while avoiding the shadows caused by your partner and the environment.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Cannibal Sector 1 Conversion Document
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

[Cannibal Sector 1 Conversion Document] provides all rules, stats and profiles required to use the content of SLA Industries: Cannibal Sector 1 with the new SLA Industries 2nd Edition rules.

boardgame.name: Hunter Sheets 2 Conversion Document
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

[Hunter Sheets 2 Conversion Document provides] the rules, stats and profiles required to use the content of Hunter Sheets Issue Two with the new SLA Industries 2nd Edition rules are [sic] presented.

boardgame.name: Enclave Civil War Campaign
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This Campaign takes place in the regions of Fallout (1997) and Fallout 2. The story is this; a group of Elites is frustrated with the way the Enclave is being governed. The leader of this group is none other than the famous Captain Anthony Fassard (Enclave Campaign Resource Guide). The others are Alexander Rayes, Christine Wolf, and the reclusive Frank Jaeger. After Fassard’s alleged death, the rest of his group defect and are ardently sought after by the Enclave. Leading the search is Major Jane Henderson. The story Line can easily go like this with a split down the middle as to where the two teams are going. The party should have close affiliation to the Enclave in order to make it easier to do this storyline, this is not to say Brotherhood cant get involved with this, it just means that its harder to get them involved in the storyline of this group. The storyline will flow fluidly to the end of the story.

boardgame.name: A Trader's Guide to Tennessee
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Child I tell you the story that has been told for many years through our tribe, long ago, before the scourge, there were great tribes, they ruled massive lands, one day these tribes went to war, they invoked the wrath of god, but god saw that these tribes had become to powerful, so his wrath fell on all of them, and the land changed, forever. But, god is not completely cruel, he spared some and gave everyone just enough to live, and his wrath bore new beasts, so became the world. Many tribes ruled the land, but some weren't satisfied with that, so they became raiders or built towns out of scrap, and some came from Vaults, and others simply hid from god and started anew in the ruins of the Old Ones. Then the Super-Mutants came, and now they have become part of this intricate web, like that of a Dryder's, this web Tenessee.


- Athulu, Uiaoe Shaman

boardgame.name: The Knightly Order Sourcebook
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Before the war had even started plans were being layed so that if the world did ‘die’ in nuclear fire then at least some of the most gifted people would survive the holocaust and gradually spread and restore order from the lawless lands that would survive.

boardgame.name: Puddle Hermit
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A Puddle Hermit is a fat, bloated breed of arachnid found throughout the Cannibal Sector, but most commonly located in the Lennox Territories. It is known to crouch for days at the water’s edge, gradually absorbing small quantities of stagnant water from puddles and lakes, storing the fluid inside a bulbous sac within its abdomen. Over time the Puddle Hermit converts these contents into a highly corrosive acid, which grows stronger the longer it is allowed to ferment.

boardgame.name: Combat Gods and Killing Machines
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

There are a number of people who want to play something along the lines of a contract killer, but they’re not too sure of how to start out doing so, this is a collection of random thoughts on how to start working on such a project.

boardgame.name: Killing in the Name of...
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

“Since the beginning of time there have been wars, these wars were fought by soldiers, among each type of soldiers there were those who were better than the others, and then there were the best, and the best of the best. That is the what I am, there are none that can best me”


- Alexander C’sal, Darknight operative on new paris, prior to being debriefed by Cloak Division, current whereabouts unknown.

boardgame.name: Stormer Sourcebook
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Two hundred miles on the northern border of Mort is the province of Hiarakia, around which is the largely impenetrable metal desert. To fully understand the nature of this construction, it is necessary to understand some of the events which went into the creation of the Hiarakian colony.

24 is a SLA Industries scenario designed for 5 or 6 players (Op's) and 1 Games Master (GM).
...
Written Exclusively for GenCon UK 2003

From the introduction:

The Sector 740, Lower Downtown, is a sprawling mass of urban decay; tenements, industrial sites, tumbled down walk ways, free-ways and abandoned Gauss Train tunnels and rails.

boardgame.name: Dante
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

OK you meatheads listen up and listen good, ‘cos I’m here to introduce you to what is going to be your most miserable, dangerous and possibly shortest career move within SLA Industries, welcome boys and girls to ‘Dante’ the War World.

boardgame.name: In to the Light: An Ebon Sourcebook
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the beginning the Ebon species evolved on their homeworld of Static much like any other. Very little is known of the times before Intruder’s arrival, only legends and myths found inscribed within the Tas Tuo give any indication of ancient Ebon society. The legends speak of a time when Ebons fought amongst themselves, and eventually matured beyond war and entered into an age of peace; as nomadic tribes, they wandered the turbulent surface of their world, seeking to understand it, but it remained tantalisingly beyond their reach. Evolution began to shape them, granting them abilities to survive the encroaching Ice Age. Here can be found the first glimpses of true Ebb use, in the ability that Intruder would develop into the discipline of Red Thermal. Like other species, the first truly distinct achievement of the Ebons was the harnessing of fire.

boardgame.name: Howling Fury: A Frother Sourcebook
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Frothers are humans that have become, or were born addicted to the various narcotics produced and supplied by SLA Industries. The term ’Frother’ is derived from the way these drug addicts tend to foam at the mouth once they are in the grip of their ’fix’, though this is usually only apparent when the user is on ’combat drugs’.

boardgame.name: The Sh'mr
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Sh'mr were named and first catalogued by the Shaktar. The name Sh'mr is itself very hard for the Shaktar to pronounce, and reflects their ancient hatred of this diabolic race.

User summary:

A new race.

boardgame.name: Revelation Burning
boardgame.description:
Written Exclusively for Euro GenCon 2001

From the introduction:

You’re kicking back, relaxing in one of your favourite watering holes, the Hive, when through the crowded bar you see a DarkFinder approaching, smiling as he eyes up you and your squad. Upon reaching your table he casually tosses down extermination warrants, each hits the table and skids to a halt, showing them to have your names on them. The DarkFinder looks you over, “now that I have your attention. My name is Sirbed.” The DarkFinder shows you an SCL card with the Cloak Division department bar code and SCL of 5A. Sirbed continues, “I have a BPN that I’d like you to undertake. Succeed and the warrants go away. Fail and they take effect.” Sirbed reaches in to his long coat and produces a manila envelope which he places on the table, “within the envelope are details of the BPN. Read them. Equip yourselves. Be back here within two hours to await your transport. Any questions?”

boardgame.name: Entrapment
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

++ *- begin broadcast - *++

If you’re reading this, then you’re already dead.

Surprised?

You may not know it yet, but you are dead. Your life’s a thing of the past; being sorted, examined, judged, then meticulously wiped clean of all achievement, a lie put in it’s place. The version of Vent that was used to implant this message on your com’s system has already alerted IA and Cloak. The pictures and sounds contained in the i.mj files have already been ‘bled’ over in to the Third Eye receiver for the Sector.

Whether you read on, view the files or read the transcripts is irrelevant.

You are already dead. Dead because they will never believe you.

boardgame.name: Bag Scene
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

[The characters] travel through Downtown to the site where the paramedics are preparing the body for removal, the players arrive just as the paramedics are zipping up the bag. As the bag is being loaded into whatever the players have to move it, they are attacked...

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Broken Token Acrylic Overlay
boardgame.description: Plastic cubes and player boards got you down? Bump the table and now you have no idea where your resources were? We've got your back! Our clear, acrylic overlay trays designed specifically for Terraforming Mars solve the issue of run-away cubes. Simply place our tray over the player board and enjoy!

boardgame.name: Cube Hunters Arena
boardgame.description:
In Cube Hunters Arena you start as a small cube with a bow and gain new weapons and abilities after surviving multiple types and sizes of enemies with different weapons in a arena.

Source: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.QUANTUMGAM....

boardgame.name: Total Tank Simulator
boardgame.description:
Play as a commander deciding your army configuration and tactical deployment on the field on massive battles. But also experience first line action instantly by taking control of individual units on the fly, from tanks or planes to snipers and more.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Song of Horror
boardgame.description:
Song of Horror, is a cinematic third-person survival horror. Help Daniel Noyer, our protagonist, solve a mystery threatening his very existence by controlling not only him, but up to 16 playable characters.

Song of Horror focuses on its narrative, featuring a story influenced by horror masters such as Poe, Lovecraft and M.R. James; on The Presence, the game’s relentless AI, capable of procedurally generating dangers of all kinds, and on the permanent death of its cast.

The game brings back the dread of the old-school classics along with modern and innovative mechanics.

Source: The Developer Website.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Sound Effects of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Minoria
boardgame.description:
Ink and blood stain the streets of Ramezia. Witches must burn and sins must be judged. Venture forth as Sister Semilla to burn down the pillars of heresy in Minoria, an action-platformer by the creators of Momodora.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Deleveled
boardgame.description:
The cooperative single-player puzzle-platformer with no jump button. Find creative ways to use gravity to your advantage as you navigate the mind-bending world of Deleveled.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The Ambassador: Fractured Timelines
boardgame.description:
The Ambassador: Fractured Timelines is a twin-stick fantasy shooter centered around the ability to stop time. You'll play as Gregor, a newly recruited member of the Eternal Fellowship, and an Ambassador of Time. Just as you are learning to use your newfound powers, the Fellowship's capital city is mysteriously destroyed! As one of the only remaining fellows, you must find those responsible and return Tamaris to its former glory.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Dyreskoven
boardgame.description:
Join in on an adventure in the forest, where you will meet a lot of funny and cute animals.

The Animal Forest is a fun game for children that will take you no time to learn. However, no game played will be the same, as the game evolves differently every time you play.
Every player will get a plate, which consists of several pictures of animals, which need to be collected, in order to win the game. You should beware of the Big Bad Wolf, as collecting him will make you unable to win the game!

This game combines picture lottery with trading, stealing and collecting a lot of animals.

boardgame.name: Project L: GameTrayz Insert
Project L: GameTrayz Insert & Master Box
Project L: Master Box
boardgame.description: An exclusive insert made by GameTrayz to hold all of the components for Project L and it's expansions in one box! Includes a new box bottom (Master Box) for your base game box lid.

boardgame.name: Bot Factory
boardgame.description:
Your goal in Bot Factory is to gather projects and parts, then assemble bots, thereby fulfilling demand goals and improving the value of the bot you are making. Sandra, the factory manager from Kanban, is present here, moving to different departments and using the players' spaces. The game uses the same worker-placement mechanism from Kanban in which turn order is established by the workers' positions on the board.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Beint í mark
boardgame.description:
A football (soccer) trivia game for the whole family, with almost 3000 questions included. Five categories and three leves of difficulty so players can compete on level ground.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Now That's What I Call Music: The Board Game
boardgame.description:
From New Romantics and Britpop to house and rap, this is the soundtrack to our lives. Re-live the last few decades of great music in this fast-moving board game based on the chart-topping NOW THAT'S WHAT I CALL MUSIC albums.

—description from back of box

listing.notes:
Now That's What I Call Music Board Game made by Paul Lamond Games in 2017. Comes 100% complete and with rules. Game comes in very good and clean condition.
Shipping and Payment:
Postage to UK £3.50, payment via Paypal or bank transfer please.
Will post outside of the UK if required. Shipping cost will depend on country its going to and weight of item. Please email me for a postage price if delivery required outside outside of the UK.

boardgame.name: The Best of Christmas Game: Not For Kids
boardgame.description:
OK, so we admit we're not famous for naughty games. Clean-cut family games - that's us. But occasionally a silly, hilarious and ever so slightly crude idea occurs to us that needs an outlet and here it is: Best of Christmas NOT FOR KIDS. It's a bit of light-hearted grown-up trivia that's just a smidgeon too naughty for the younger kids, but still full of the laugh out loud fun that makes the LOGO family a British favourite!

From office party antics and their aftermath to what time we first reach for the bottle on Christmas Day, Best of Christmas NOT FOR KIDS covers the messy, boozy, mistletoe-clad reality of Christmas for adults - and from our research, most of us are making the naughty list.

—description from back of box

boardgame.name: Quick 6 III Scenario Pack
boardgame.description:
Third pack of six short Advanced Squad Leader tournament scenarios. These were designed for the 2020 West Coast Rumble.

Q13 – One Last Attempt – Dom Bütgenbach, Belgium, 22 December 1944: Game Length: 5½ Turns; Board q; Americans: 5½ Squads, 2x Leaders, 2x Machineguns, 3x 60mm mortars, & Bazooka; vs. Germans: 6x SS-Squads, 3x Leaders, 2x Machineguns, & JdgPz IV/70; Estimated Playing Time: 2 hours 21 minutes

Q14 – True to Form – The Factory, Carroceto, Italy, 25 January 1944: Game Length: 5½ Turns; Board 71; Germans: 8x Squads, 4x Leaders, 2x Machineguns, FT, 2x DC, & 2x StuG 75/34(i); vs. British: 5x Squads, 2x Leaders, 3x Machineguns, & PIAT; Estimated Playing Time 2 hours 38 minutes

Q15 – Mantes Meet Up – Mantes-Gassicourt, France, 27 August 1944: Game Length: 6 Turns; Board 10z; Americans: 11x Squads, 4x Leaders, 6x Machineguns, 2x Bazooka, & 3x M5A1; vs. Germans: 11x Squads, 3x Leaders, 4x Machineguns, & 2x StuG IIIG; Estimated Playing Time: 3 hours 26 minutes

Q16 – Defence of St. Oedenrode – St. Oedenrode, Holland, 17 September 1944: Game Length: 6 Turns; Board 59; Americans: 5x Squads, 2x Leaders, 3x Machineguns, 60mm Mortar, & Bazooka; vs. Germans: 10x Squads, 3x Leaders, & 3x Machineguns; Estimated Playing Time: 2 hours 31 minutes

Q17 – Absorbing the Thrust – Furnes, France, 28 May 1940: Game Length: 5½ Turns; Board 10z; French: 8x Squads, 3x Leaders, Machinegun, & 3x H35; vs. Germans: 6x Squads, Gun Crew 2x Leaders, Machinegun, 50mm Mortar, ATR, & 2x 3.7cm Anti-Tank Gun; Estimated Playing Time: 2 hours 50 minutes

Q18 – Seize the Crossroads – Briqueville, France, 29 June 1944: Game Length: 5½ Turns; Board 17; Germans: 5x Squads, Gun Crew, 2x Leaders, 2x Machineguns, 75mm Infantry Gun, & Fortifications; vs. Americans: 12x Squads, HS, 3x Leaders, 2x Machineguns, 2x 60mm Mortars, 3x Bazookas, FT, & 3x DC; Estimated Playing Time: 2 hours 32 minutes

Each scenario is played on half a map board with a handful of counters per each side; these scenarios are fast, with a limited amount of SSR, to ensure minimum set up time and maximum game time.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Twisted Dungeons
boardgame.description:
Never venture in the same old dungeon again.

Twisted Dungeons is a supplement for Four Against Darkness, suited for all levels of play, that will change your dungeons forever.

It’s easy to use: just roll d88 (two eight-sided dice) as the adventure starts, and read the corresponding numbered entry. The book will inject unpredictable events and themes into your dungeon exploration: 64 dungeon complications, ranging from mosquito infestation to teleporting mirrors, from slippery tunnels carved out of ice to chambers with magic-enhancing properties. Most complications will come with interesting rewards, in experience or loot.

Twisted Dungeons may be used alongside its companion volume, Twisted Minions, to create even more random variations. With a bit of common sense, it will work with any book in the Four Against Darkness line.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Four Against the Abyss: A Supplement for Four Against Darkness

boardgame.name: Warhammer Underworlds: Online - Warband: The Chosen Axes
boardgame.description: Honor, gold, and a desire to banish the curse that haunts the city of Shadespire - these are what drive the mercenary Fyreslayers. Unlock this warband and play as The Chosen Axes in Warhammer Underworlds: Online now.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Underworlds: Online - Warband: Eyes of the Nine
boardgame.description: In the name of the mighty Tzeentch, god of magic and sorcery, Vortemis the All-seeing and his sworn acolytes seek to open a pathway between Shadespire and the Realm of Chaos. Unlock this warband and play as the Eyes of the Nine in Warhammer Underworlds: Online now.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Underworlds: Online - Warband: Thorns of the Briar Queen
boardgame.description: Dragged out from her crystal tomb beneath the city of Shadespire, the Briar Queen and her spectral army of geists, and spirits are ready to combat all who trespass in the Mirrored City. Unlock this warband and play as the Thorns of the Briar Queen in Warhammer Underworlds: Online now.

boardgame.name: Vampire: The Masquerade – Shadows of New York
boardgame.description:
Vampire: The Masquerade – Shadows of New York is a visual novel set in the rich universe of Vampire: The Masquerade. It acts as a stand-alone expansion and a companion piece to our previous title, Coteries of New York. While Coteries was a general introduction to the world depicted in the 5th Edition of the hit tabletop role-playing game, Shadows presents a more personal and unique tale.

- A visual novel tackling themes of personal and political horror, suitable for both Vampire: The Masquerade veterans, and fans of narrative-driven games who are newcomers to the setting.
- A stand-alone expansion to Coteries of New York. See the familiar metropolis through entirely different eyes. Expect new characters, new locations and a fresh original soundtrack.
- Play as a member of the Lasombra clan. Formerly vicious foes of the Camarilla, the Magisters decided to search for safety in the ranks of their former enemies. Master the shadows and communicate with the inhabitants of the Other Side, but beware – Oblivion is always lurking out there, ready to devour you whole.
- Explore the streets of the Big Apple. While you search for ways to satiate your bloodthirst, catch glimpses of various fascinating vignettes and forge connections with the eccentric inhabitants of the city. One playthrough won’t be enough to see it all.
- Shape your mind, shape your fate. You used to avoid defining yourself and tried to stay neutral, but given your situation, you can no longer afford to do so. The choices you make will alter the way you think, and your thinking will alter the paths you take.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Siege Defenders TD
boardgame.description:
Create your own strategy with different towers and get ready for an epic siege!

Source: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.QuantumMob....

boardgame.name: The Shape Chomper Game
boardgame.description:
One of Mattel's All-Together games, with no loose pieces. From the instructions:
"Be the first player to collect one of each of the four shapes before the SHAPE CHOMPER can gobble any of them up!"

boardgame.name: The Lost Clans (fan expansion for Age Of War)
boardgame.description:
Lost Clans introduces 5 new clans to the game, with a total of 12 new cards. These clans add more difficult combinations and allow for a better experience with 4+ players. The clans are as follows:

Utsunomiya - 1 card (4 pts) - 4 flipped
Saito - 2 cards (3 pts each) - 6 flipped
Otomo - 3 cards (2 pts, 3 pts, 4 pts) - 11 flipped
Kuroda - 3 cards (2 pts, 2 pts, 3 pts) - 9 flipped
Anegakoji - 3 cards (2 pts, 2 pts, 2 pts) - 7 flipped

All clans use real Japanese family names and crests, and have been designed to match the original style.
I ordered my cards from https://www.printplaygames.com/
- Custom Size Rectangular Cards #1
- Matte Premium Black Core
- length and width 2.75 inches

Front and back templates are attached.

boardgame.name: UNO: Trolls World Tour
boardgame.description:
Sing, dance, and hug... then play this Trolls World Tour edition of UNO!

Includes an exclusive "Tiny Diamond's Mix Tape Rule," which forces the next player to draw a card from each player's hand.

And don't forget to yell "UNO!" before the party is over!

boardgame.name: Clue Junior: The Case of the Broken Toy
boardgame.description:
It's the case of the broken toy in this "whodunit" game for kids. In this Clue Junior game, players are on a mission to discover which toy was broken, who broke it, and what time it was broken. Players roll the die to see if they can move their character, look under other character pawns, or peek under furniture tokens for clues. Kids can play detective, marking the detective notepad as they find clues, eliminate choices, and eventually solve the mystery. The game features classic Clue characters: Miss Scarlett, Col. Mustard, Mr. Green, Mrs. Peacock, Prof. Plum, and Dr. Orchid. Time for an accusation? Go for it! A correct accusation wins the game.

Includes gameboard, 6 character pawns, 6 furniture tokens, 7 white bases, 7 yellow bases, detective notepad, die, label sheet, and instructions.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Cluedo / Clue (Parker Brothers, et al)
Game: Cluedo Junior / Clue Junior (Parker Brothers, et al)

boardgame.name: The Offensive Band Name Generator: Album Cover Expansion
boardgame.description:
This is an expansion for the party game The Offensive Band Name Generator. It includes 50 Album Cover cards, 2 brand new Theme Lists and a rules sheet.

With this expansion, players will draw album cover cards and work to make band names and album names that best fit the images drawn.

boardgame.name: Eddi Stachel
Egeltje Plof
Porcupine Pop
Пугливый ёжик
boardgame.description:
Who will make the porcupine pop? This exciting kids' game combines simple play with silliness and suspense. Roll the die, press the porcupine's nose that number of times, and hope his darts don't fly out. No one knows when that will happen, and the only player not to make the porcupine pop wins. Kids can switch up the gameplay and try a round where whoever makes him pop first wins. Or try a game where each dart color is assigned points and when the porcupine pops, players race to grab as many darts as they can, and the player with the most points wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Blanc-Manger Coco: Le Coming Out
boardgame.description:
The irreverence Blanc-Manger Coco now explore the theme of LGBT + culture, published in partnership with the magazine Têtu.

Mix the cards or not with the other games in the range: you decide.

Contains 160 reply cards and 40 question cards.

boardgame.name: 100 Rumours to Hear in or About the Great Rift: Riftspan Reaches, Touchstone and Afawahisa
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

When asking around in the spaceport bar or anywhere else, Travellers may overhear rumours about events on other worlds. They may be insuring about a different matter entirely and stumble across additional information by accident. This supplement has 100 rumours that Travellers could hear. They can be used as misdirection, background information or as potential adventure hooks. The rumours in this supplement cover the Great Rift, in particular the sectors of Riftspan Reaches, Touchstone and Afawahisa.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

Tensions have been rising on Ar'Chrinhdah in the Ekteiu subsector of Touchstone. The world is primarily an Ascondi world, though there are both Aslan ihatei and human settlers there as well. The ihatei have been getting into conflicts with the Ascondi, and they have superior technology. The Ascondi, though, have vastly superior numbers and the ihatei have been avoiding fighting a foe that greatly outnumbers them. However, the frequency of conflicts between ihatei and Ascondi has been increasing; the ihatei are claiming that the Ascondi are starting them and should be dealt with.

The Aosola Gulf in the Aosola subsector of Touchstone is home to a higher density of rogue comets and planetoids than the Great Rift itself. An expedition to one of these has claimed to have discovered evidence that many of the comets and planetoids once shared the same system, which was destroyed, including the star, a long time ago. Most are dismissing this claim as a complete fabrication.

The Ascondi of Khuiseatasyeh in the Yuyahtao subsector of Afawahisa are seeing their civilisation disappear beneath glaciers as their world has descended into an ice age. There are rumours that the speed of the glaciers' advance has recently sped up a lot, which would mean that the Ascondi civilisation is going to be crushed even more rapidly than thought.

The Ascondi of Ultima Thule in the Phobetor system in the Eternal Dark subsector of Touchstone claim that the planet is their homeland, despite there being absolutely no evidence to back this up, nor are the Ascondi willing to provide any other than the bald claim that it is. Some researchers believe that this claim is being used to cover something up, a blatant lie being used to distract from the truth, though no-one seems to have any idea what this truth might be.

The Aslan Ehaaiwyairl clan was settled on Uaka in the Ftyoauial subsector of Riftspan Reaches because they lacked the ability to refuse an order to settle elsewhere, and are considered an expendable tripwire in cause of trouble stemming out of Phobetor, even though the Hierate doesn't officially acknowledge that system's existence. The Ehaaiwyairl have reverted to a more traditional Aslan lifestyle, and some of the occasional visitors to the world have been claiming that all Aslan should take up that manner of living again, as it is a more harmonious way than the current way.

One page is the front cover, one page the front matter and one page is ads.

boardgame.name: A Baker's Dozen of Sorcerous Items (ET)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This supplement has 13 new sorcerous items for your Eldritch Tales game. Each is given a name, description and powers. Though many of these powers are useful, be warned, magic in such a setting is rarely safe, and these items can cause problems, sometimes terminal ones, if they are overused by their owners.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are the items:

Bone of the Deeps
Brass Oracle
Canopic Jar of Set-Hotep
Clay Guardian
Cloak of the Hidden
Elder Rock
Grey Dagger

Lens of Perception
Sanctified Cloth
Smoking Lamp

Trojan Helm

One page is the front cover, one page the front matter, one page is ads and one the Open Game License.
boardgame.rpg: Eldritch Tales: Lovecraftian White Box Role-Playing

boardgame.name: 100 Underwater Wilderness Locations
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is a collection of 100 different wilderness locations that can be dropped into a setting to enliven a journey. The locations are of many different types, from large to small. Each location has been named and is described, and many could have potential adventure and encounter hooks as well.

All the locations are in intended to be underwater, with flora and flora appropriately suited to the location.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

Hungering Graveyard: This section of the ocean floor is covered in the corpses of sea monsters of many different types, varying from the just deceased to the long dead and skeletal. The oldest remains are buried beneath the sediment on the sea bed. Sea monsters seem to travel to this graveyard for some reason, where they die. The name comes from the belief that this attraction is not natural, and something in the region hungers for sea monsters, luring them to the graveyard to die.

Impossible Tablemount: This flat-topped underwater volcano does not penetrate the ocean's surface, when viewed from above, yet when viewed from the sea floor it appears to stretch far higher than it should. Those descending onto the tablemount from above are easily able to do so, yet those who try to come at it from below are never able to reach the summit, which appears to constantly recede into the distance, no matter how far is travelled, even if the distance travelled means that the ocean's surface should have been broached.

Infernal Reef: An oval platform reef of coral a mile across growing on a continental shelf, this is avoided by most creatures in the area. The reef glows with a sullen red light and the surrounding water has a strong brimstone taste to it. Flora and fauna found in the area often has a fiendish taint to it and its thought that the reef has grown around a portal to the Hells, the source of the taint and the glow. No true fiends from Hells have been found in the region and it’s believed that the reef itself blocks the portal, preventing creatures from getting through.

Iridescent Plain: Located far below the ocean's surface, an abyssal plain would normally be dark, yet this one sparkles with points of iridescent light and can be seen from afar. The local sea life has adapted to the, for an abyssal plain, unusually high levels of light. The motes of iridescence blink on and off in seemingly random patterns, yet when the plain itself is approached closely, it proves to be impossible to close in on the iridescence, which always blinks out when approached.

Lair of the Aquatic Ogre: This underwater network of caves burrows deep into the rock. It was the lair of a feared aquatic ogre, one who terrorised the surrounding seas both above and below the surface. The ogre had many followers, most through fear, giving them a large army. Many years ago, an expedition was sent to deal with the ogre. Although the expedition's members did not return, the ogre hasn't been seen since and their followers have dispersed. It's assumed that the ogre and the expedition's members both died during the confrontation.

One page is the front cover, one page the front matter and one page is ads.

It is a short, rules light TTRPG about being an adventurer, seeking adventure and loot. Well, mostly loot. A d6 is used to generate characters and scenarios and play the game.

The current version is a two page game; hopefully, it will have a foldable zine version added later.

See the video for how to print out a layered PDF.

Cartography by Dyson Logos, some artwork copyright William McAusland, used with permission.
